dataList.name: Hardblood weapon found while resting
dataList.desc:
In the midst of our battle against the nigh-endless Bloodbag horde...

<Hm...?>

... we came across an ominous object on the ground.

While it resembled the Bloodbags' weapons somewhat, there was enough to distinguish it from them.

"It's gotta be a powerful weapon, right?"

"It has got to be a rather dangerous weapon."

"Verily, 'tis an item most puzzling!"

Clearly, the Sinners are having a hard time coming to a consensus.

... Looks like it's up to me to decide whether we're picking that thing up or not.

options.messageDesc: Select to gain a Bleed E.G.O Gift
result:
It should probably come in handy, in whichever form that might be.

After a brief rest, the Sinners forged on toward the destination.

... But none of us noticed how the Sinner who held the weapon seemed unable to tear their eyes away from bloodstains.

I wasn't just about to carry around a mysterious artifact like that with us.

The Sinners forged on toward the next destination, despite their mild disappointment.

dataList.name: There is a useful piece of gear on a W Corp. Cleanup Agent who was turned into a Bloodbag.
dataList.desc:
W Corp. Agents who turned into Bloodbags made for higher difficulty enemies than the other Bloodbags aboard the train.

Once they were defeated, we found a strange-looking gear from the aftermath of the battle.

I'd seen a W Corp. Identity with that gauntlet before.

"This gear is gunked up with gore; it'll be difficult to use it as-is."

Looks like we'll have to go through considerable trouble to bring it back to working order...

options.messageDesc: Wrath & Gloom Advantage check. Pass to gain a Bleed E.G.O Gift.

result:
We don't have the luxury of wasting our time over something like this.

Leaving the gauntlet behind, we forged on.

dataList.name: There is a useful piece of gear on the body of a W Corp. Cleanup Agent who was turned into a Bloodbag.
dataList.desc:
Looks like it's almost fully repaired.

But maybe risking an injury to a Sinner isn't worth the effort.

options.messageDesc: Lust & Envy Advantage check. Pass to gain a Charge E.G.O Gift.

result:
We don't have the luxury of wasting our time over something like this.

Leaving behind the gauntlet gunked up with gore, we forged on.

dataList.name: A merchan passenger
dataList.desc:
This section seems to be rather crowded with passengers.

Among them, we notice a surprisingly calm and collected passenger.

"Come closer, won't you...?"

There was a bottle full of suspicious looking pills in his outstretched hands.

The passenger proceeds to explain that his present sanity is thanks to the pills in his possession.

"Woud you like to try some yourself?"

options.messageDesc: Spend Cost to heal all allies' HP & SP
result:
I paid the price and distributed the pill among the Sinners.

"Ooh... this ain't half bad."

The effects were quite apparent; the pills seemed to have healed everyone, both physically and mentally.

"Please, do come again..."

The passengers bade us farewell, so we continued on after responding in kind.

options.message: Just take a quick look, then leave.
result:
No need to pay out of pocket for something that suspicious.

We continued on.

dataList.name: A W Corp. Cleanup Agent is battling a group of Bloodbags.
dataList.desc:
"Lo! A lone warrior battles a horde of Bloodbags!"

The Sinners were looking at someone wearing a W Corp. uniform.

He seemed rather skilled, but the sheer number of Bloodbags were about to overwhelm him.

<We've got to help—>

But I am cut off by another horde of Bloodbags that poured into this cabin, surrounding us.

"Dammit... prepare for battle!"

"Y-yet what of the lone warrior?!"

"Well—"

options.message: Lend him an E-Type Dimensional Dagger.
options.messageDesc: Select to gain a Charge E.G.O Gift
result:
"This should help, at least...!"

We threw the dagger at the W Corp. Agent...

... and hit a Bloodbag squarely in the back of its head, just as it was about to sink its teeth into him. He quickly pulled out the dagger and used it to defend himself.

Once we were done cleaning up, he thanked us and returned the dagger.

"Thank you for stepping in! Another second and I'd also have turned into one of those mons—"

Horrified, the Agent cuts himself short and shifts away from the grim thought.

"I'm pulling back. Take this—it's not much, but I hope it helps."

options.message: Send a Sinner to assist the W Corp. Agent.
options.messageDesc: Envy & Wrath Advantage check. Pass to gain a Charge E.G.O Gift.

result:
As we had our own share of Bloodbags to deal with, we decided to save ourselves first.

It wasn't long before the W Corp. Agent was swept up in the relentless swarm of Bloodbags.

We could hear his agonizing screams through the stampede, pleading for anyone to rescue him, but... it was too late for us to do anything.
